data.sentence: The word أَمْ comes from the root ا م and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالُوا comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
The word مِنَ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word أَنْتَ comes from the root ا ن ت and is associated with the meanings: you (singular)

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word بِالْحَقِّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.

data.meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive
data.sentence: The word أَجِئْتَنَا comes from the root ج ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive

data.meanings: played/sported/gamed/jested/joked, passtime (in an unserious thing), engage in idle sport without meaning or purpose, slaver/drivel, stupid/fool.
data.sentence: The word اللَّاعِبِينَ comes from the root ل ع ب and is associated with the meanings: played/sported/gamed/jested/joked, passtime (in an unserious thing), engage in idle sport without meaning or purpose, slaver/drivel, stupid/fool.
